And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
And you, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the city of blood? Then make her know all her abominations.
And you shall say, Thus says the Lord GOD: A city that sheds blood in her midst, that her time may come, and that has made idols against herself to defile herself.

By the blood you have shed you are guilty, and by your idols which you have made you have defiled yourself; and you have brought near your days, and have come to your years. Therefore I have made you a reproach to the nations and a mockery to all the lands.
Those who are near and those who are far from you shall mock you, O defiled in name, full of tumult.
Behold, the princes of Israel, each according to his arm, have been in you to shed blood.
Father and mother they have treated lightly in you; the sojourner they have oppressed in your midst; the orphan and the widow they have wronged in you.
You have despised My holy things and have profaned My sabbaths.
Men of slander have been in you for the shedding of blood; and on the mountains they have eaten in you; lewdness they have committed in your midst.
In you a man has uncovered his father’s nakedness; in you they have humbled her who was unclean in her impurity.
And one has committed abomination with his neighbor’s wife, and one has defiled his daughter-in-law with lewdness, and one has humbled his sister, his father’s daughter, in your midst.
They have taken bribes within you to shed blood; you have taken interest and increase, and you have extorted your neighbors by oppression, and Me you have forgotten, declares the Lord GOD.
And behold, I have struck my hands together at your unjust gain which you have made, and at your blood which has been in your midst.
Will your heart stand, or will your hands be strong, in the days when I deal with you? I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will do it.
And I will scatter you among the nations, and disperse you through the lands, and I will consume your uncleanness out of you.
And you shall be profaned in yourself before the eyes of the nations, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, the house of Israel has become to Me as dross; all of them are bronze and tin and iron and lead in the midst of the furnace; they are the dross of silver.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Because you have all become dross, therefore, behold, I am gathering you into the midst of Jerusalem.

As they gather silver and copper and iron and lead and tin into the midst of a furnace, to blow the fire upon it to melt it, so will I gather you in My anger and in My wrath, and I will set you there and melt you.
And I will gather you and blow upon you with the fire of My wrath, and you shall be melted in the midst of it.
As silver is melted in the midst of the furnace, so shall you be melted in the midst of her; and you shall know that I, the LORD, have poured out My fury upon you.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, say to her, You are a land that is not cleansed, nor rained upon in the day of indignation.
A conspiracy of her prophets is in her midst, like a roaring lion tearing prey; they have devoured souls, they take treasure and precious things, they have multiplied her widows in her midst.

Her priests have done violence to My law and have profaned My holy things; they have made no distinction between the holy and the common, neither have they made known the difference between the unclean and the clean, and from My sabbaths they have hidden their eyes, and I am profaned in their midst.
Her princes in her midst are like wolves tearing the prey, to shed blood, to destroy lives, in order to gain unjust gain.
Her prophets have daubed for them with whitewash, seeing vanity and divining lies for them, saying, Thus says the Lord GOD, when the LORD has not spoken.
The people of the land have practiced extortion and committed robbery, and they have oppressed the poor and needy, and have wronged the sojourner without justice.
And I sought from among them a man who would build up the wall and stand in the breach before Me for the land, that I should not destroy it, but I found none.
So I have poured out My indignation upon them; I have consumed them with the fire of My wrath; I have brought their way upon their own head, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, there were two women, daughters of one mother.
And they played the harlot in Egypt; in their youth they played the harlot. There their breasts were pressed, and there their virgin bosoms were handled.
Their names were Oholah the elder and Oholibah her sister; and they became Mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names: Samaria is Oholah, and Jerusalem is Oholibah.
And Oholah played the harlot while she was mine, and she lusted after her lovers, after the Assyrians who were near.
Clothed in blue, governors and rulers, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding upon horses.
She bestowed her harlotries upon them, the choicest sons of Assyria all of them, and with all for whom she lusted, with all their idols, she defiled herself.
And her whorings from Egypt she did not forsake, for they lay with her in her youth, and they handled the breasts of her virginity, and poured out their lust upon her.
Therefore I gave her into the hand of her lovers, into the hand of the sons of Assyria, upon whom she had lusted.
They uncovered her nakedness, they took her sons and her daughters, and her they slew with the sword; and she became a name among women, and judgments were executed upon her.
And her sister Oholibah saw it, yet she corrupted her lust more than she, and her acts of harlotry beyond the whoredoms of her sister.
She lusted after the sons of Assyria, governors and officials nearby, clothed in perfect splendor, horsemen riding on horses, all of them choice young men.
And I saw that she was defiled; one way was to them both.
And she added yet to her whorings, and saw men portrayed upon the wall, images of the Chaldeans engraved with vermilion.
girded with belts upon their loins, with flowing turbans upon their heads, all of them in the appearance of officers, the likeness of the sons of Babylon, Chaldeans, the land of their birth.
She lusted after them, at the sight of her eyes, and she sent messengers to them, to the Chaldeans.
And the sons of Babylon came in to her into the bed of love, and they defiled her with their whoredom; and she was polluted by them, and her soul was loath of them.
And she uncovered her whorings and exposed her nakedness; then my soul was loathed by her, just as my soul was loathed by her sister.
And she multiplied her whorings, remembering the days of her youth, when she played the harlot in the land of Egypt.
And she lusted after their paramours, whose flesh is the flesh of donkeys, and whose emission is the emission of horses.
And you revisited the lewdness of your youth, when the Egyptians handled your bosom for the sake of your youthful breasts.
Therefore, Oholibah, thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am stirring up your lovers against you, those from whom your soul has turned in loathing, and I will bring them against you on every side.

sons of Babylon and all the Chaldeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa, all the sons of Assyria with them, desirable young men, governors and officials all of them, captains and men of renown, all of them riders on horses.

And they shall come against you with an array of chariot and wheel and with an assembly of peoples; shield and buckler and helmet they shall set against you all around, and I will set judgment before them, and they shall judge you according to their judgments.

And I will set My jealousy against you, and they shall deal with you in fury; they shall remove your nose and your ears, and your remnant shall fall by the sword. They shall take your sons and your daughters, and the rest of you shall be devoured by fire.
They shall strip you of your garments and take away your splendid ornaments.
And I will cause your lewdness to cease from you, and your whorings brought from the land of Egypt; and you shall not lift up your eyes to them, nor shall you remember Egypt any more.
For thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am giving you into the hand of those you hate, into the hand of those from whom your soul is alienated.

And they shall deal with you in hatred, and shall take away all your labor, and shall leave you naked and bare; and the nakedness of your whoredoms shall be uncovered, and your lewdness and your adulteries.
These things are done to you because of your whorings after the nations, because you were defiled with their idols.
In the way of your sister you have walked, and I will put her cup into your hand.
Thus says the Lord GOD: You shall drink your sister’s cup, deep and wide; it shall be for laughter and for scorn, abundant to hold.
Drunkenness and sorrow you shall be filled with, the cup of horror and desolation, the cup of your sister Samaria.
And you shall drink it and drain it out, and its shards you shall gnaw, and your breasts you shall tear; for I have spoken, declares the Lord GOD.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Because you have forgotten Me and cast Me behind your back, therefore you also, bear your lewdness and your harlotries.
And the LORD said to me, Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then declare to them their abominations.

For they have committed adultery, and blood is in their hands; and with their idols they have committed adultery, and even their sons whom they bore to Me they have caused to pass through to them to be devoured.
Moreover, this they have done to Me: they have defiled My sanctuary in that very day, and have profaned My sabbaths.
And when they slaughtered their sons to their idols, then they came into My sanctuary on that same day to profane it; and behold, thus have they done in the midst of My house.

And furthermore, they sent for men who came from far away, to whom a messenger had been sent, and behold, they came—for whom you washed yourself, painted your eyes, and adorned yourself with ornaments.
And you sat upon a stately bed, and a table prepared before it; and my incense and my oil you set upon it.

And the sound of a carefree multitude was in her; and with men in great number there were brought drunkards from the wilderness, and they put bracelets upon their hands, and a crown of splendor upon their heads.
Then I said of her who is worn out with adulteries, Now will they commit her whoredoms, even she with them.
And they went in to her as one goes in to a harlot; so they went in to Oholah and to Oholibah, women of lewdness.
But righteous men, they shall judge them with the judgment of adulteresses and with the judgment of those who shed blood; for adulteresses they are, and blood is in their hands.
For thus says the Lord GOD: Bring up a congregation against them, and give them over to terror and to plunder.
And the assembly shall stone them with stones, and cut them down with their swords; they shall slay their sons and their daughters, and burn their houses with fire.
Thus will I cause lewdness to cease out of the land, and all the women shall be admonished, so that they do not commit lewdness according to your lewdness.
They shall bring your lewdness upon you, and you shall bear the sins of your idols; and you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, saying,
Son of man, write for yourself the name of this day, this very day. The king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem on this very day.
And speak a parable to the house of rebellion, and say to them, Thus says the Lord GOD: Set on the pot, set it on, and also pour water into it.
Gather its pieces to it, every good piece, thigh and shoulder; fill it with choice bones.
Take the choicest of the flock, and also pile the bones beneath it; make it boil with a boiling, yes, let the bones of it be cooked within it.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Woe to the city of blood, the pot in which is its corrosion, and whose corrosion has not gone out of it. Bring it out piece by piece; no lot has fallen upon it.
For her blood is in the midst of her; upon the bare rock she set it. She did not pour it upon the ground, to cover it with dust.
To stir up wrath, to take vengeance, I have set her blood upon the bare rock, that it should not be covered.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Woe to the city of blood! I also will make great the pile of fire.
Heap on the wood, kindle the fire, consume the flesh and spice it well, and let the bones be burned.
Then set it empty upon its coals, that it may be heated and its bronze burn, and its filthiness be melted in its midst, its scum consumed.
Weariness has wearied her, yet her great filth does not go out of her; by fire her filth remains.
In your filthiness is lewdness. Because I would have cleansed you, and you were not cleansed from your uncleanness, you shall not be cleansed any more, until I have caused my fury to rest upon you.

I, the LORD, have spoken; it shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not turn back, neither will I spare, neither will I relent. According to your ways and according to your deeds they shall judge you, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, behold, I am taking from you the delight of your eyes with a plague; yet you shall not mourn nor weep, and your tears shall not come.
Groan in silence; make no mourning for the dead. Bind your turban upon you, and put your sandals on your feet; do not cover your mustache, and do not eat the bread of men.
So I spoke to the people in the morning, and my wife died in the evening; and in the morning I did as I was commanded.
And the people said to me, Will you not tell us what these things are to us, that you are doing so?
And I said to them, The word of the LORD came to me, saying,

Say to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am profaning My sanctuary, the pride of your strength, the delight of your eyes, and the longing of your soul; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind shall fall by the sword.
And you shall do as I have done: you shall not cover your upper lip, and the bread of men you shall not eat.
Your turbans shall be upon your heads, and your sandals upon your feet; you shall not mourn, and you shall not weep, but you shall waste away in your iniquities, and groan one to another.
And Ezekiel shall be to you for a sign; according to all that he has done, you shall do. When it comes, you shall know that I am the Lord GOD.

And you, son of man, is it not so that in the day when I take from them their stronghold, the joy of their glory, the delight of their eyes, and the desire of their soul, their sons and their daughters,
In that day the fugitive shall come to you, to cause it to be heard by your ears.
In that day your mouth shall be opened to the fugitive, and you shall speak and no longer be mute; and you shall be a sign to them, and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, set your face toward the children of Ammon, and prophesy against them.

And you shall say to the sons of Ammon, Hear the word of the Lord GOD: Thus says the Lord GOD, Because you said, “Aha!” over My sanctuary when it was profaned, and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste, and over the house of Judah when they went into exile,

Therefore, behold, I am giving you to the sons of the east for a possession, and they shall set their encampments in you and put their dwellings in you; they shall eat your fruit, and they shall drink your milk.
And I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels, and the children of Ammon a resting place for flocks; and you shall know that I am the LORD.
For thus says the Lord GOD: Because you clapped your hands and stamped with your foot, and rejoiced with all your spite in your soul against the land of Israel.

Therefore, behold, I have stretched out My hand against you, and I will give you as spoil to the nations, and I will cut you off from the peoples and cause you to perish from the lands; I will destroy you, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Because Moab and Seir say, “Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations,”
Therefore, behold, I am opening the flank of Moab from the cities, from his cities on his frontier, the glory of the land, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim.
To the sons of the east, together with the sons of Ammon, I will give it for a possession, so that the sons of Ammon may not be remembered among the nations.
And in Moab I will execute judgments, and they shall know that I am the LORD.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Because Edom has acted in taking vengeance against the house of Judah, and has grievously offended and taken vengeance upon them,
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: I will stretch out My hand against Edom and will cut off from it man and beast; and I will make it desolate from Teman, and they of Dedan shall fall by the sword.

I will set my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel, and they shall deal in Edom according to my anger and according to my wrath; and they shall know my vengeance, declares the Lord GOD.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Because the Philistines have acted in vengeance, and have taken vengeance with spiteful scorn in their soul, to destroy with everlasting enmity,
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I stretch out My hand against the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites, and destroy the remnant of the seacoast.
And I will execute upon them great acts of vengeance with furious rebukes; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I lay my vengeance upon them.
And it came to pass in the eleventh year, on the first of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, “Aha! She is broken, the gateway of the peoples; she is turned over to me; I shall be filled, she that is laid waste.”
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and I will bring up against you many nations, as the sea brings up its waves.
And they shall destroy the walls of Tyre, and break down her towers; and I will scrape her dust from her, and make her like the bare rock.
A bare place for the spreading of nets shall she be in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken, declares the Lord GOD, and she shall become a spoil to the nations.
And her daughters who are in the field shall be slain by the sword, and they shall know that I am the LORD.
For thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am bringing against Tyre Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon from the north, king of kings, with horse and chariot and horsemen, and a company and a great multitude.
Your daughters in the field he shall slay with the sword, and he shall set against you a siege wall, and cast up against you a mound, and raise up against you a shield.
And he shall set his battering rams against your walls, and with his swords he shall break down your towers.

From the multitude of his horses their dust shall cover you; from the noise of the horseman and of the wheels and of the chariots your walls shall shake, when he enters your gates, as men enter into a breached city.
With the hoofbeats of his horses he will trample all your streets; your people he will slay with the sword, and the pillars of your strength shall go down to the ground.

They shall plunder your wealth and seize your merchandise, and they shall break down your walls and tear down your pleasant houses; and your stones and your timber and your dust they shall cast into the midst of the waters.
I will cause the noise of your songs to cease, and the sound of your harps shall be heard no more.
I will make you a bare rock; you shall be a place for the spreading of nets. You shall be built no more, for I, the LORD, have spoken, declares the Lord GOD.
Thus says the Lord GOD to Tyre: Shall not the coastlands quake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter is wrought in your midst?

Then all the princes of the sea shall come down from their thrones, and they shall remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments; trembling they shall put on, and upon the ground they shall sit, and shall quake every moment and be appalled because of you.

And they shall lift up a lamentation over you and shall say to you, How you have perished, you who dwelt by the seas, O city renowned, who were strong in the sea, you and your inhabitants, who put your terror upon all who dwelt in you.
Now shall the coastlands tremble in the day of your fall, and the islands that are in the sea shall be dismayed at your departure.
For thus says the Lord GOD: When I make you a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited, when I bring up the deep over you, and the great waters cover you,

Then I will bring you down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of old, and I will make you dwell in the lowest parts of the earth, like the ancient ruins, with those who go down to the pit, so that you will not be inhabited; and I will set glory in the land of the living.
I will make you a terror, and you shall be no more; though you are sought for, you shall never again be found, forever, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
And you, son of man, lift up a lamentation over Tyre.
And say to Tyre, who dwells at the entrances of the sea, the merchant of the peoples to many coastlands: Thus says the Lord GOD: O Tyre, you have said, I am perfect in beauty.
In the heart of the seas are your borders; your builders perfected your beauty.
They built for you all your planks of cypress from Senir; they took a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast upon you.
Of oaks from Bashan they made your oars; your deck they made of ivory inlaid in boxwood from the coasts of Kittim.
Fine embroidered linen from Egypt was your sail, to be for you as a banner; blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah were your covering.
The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers; your wise men, O Tyre, were in you, they were your pilots.
The elders of Gebal and her wise men were in you, caulking your seams; all the ships of the sea with their mariners were in you to barter your merchandise.
Persia and Lud and Put were in your army, your men of war; they hung shield and helmet upon you; they gave you your splendor.
The men of Arvad, with your army, were upon your walls all around, and valiant men were in your towers; they hung their shields upon your walls all around; they perfected your beauty.
Tarshish was your merchant because of the abundance of all your wealth; with silver, iron, tin, and lead they paid for your wares.
Javan, Tubal, and Meshech were your merchants; they traded the persons of men and vessels of bronze for your wares.
From the house of Togarmah they gave horses and war-horses and mules for your merchandise.
The sons of Dedan were your merchants; many coastlands were the traders of your hand; horns of ivory and ebony they brought as your payment.
Aram was your merchant because of the abundance of your works; with turquoise, purple, and embroidered work, and fine linen, and coral, and rubies they gave for your wares.
Judah and the land of Israel, they were your merchants; with wheat of Minnith and confections, and honey and oil and balm they gave your merchandise.
Damascus was your merchant because of the abundance of your works, by reason of the multitude of all riches, with wine of Helbon and white wool.
Dan and Javan from Uzal traded with you; wrought iron, cassia, and calamus were in your merchandise.
Dedan was your merchant in garments of freedom for riding.
Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were the merchants of your hand; with lambs and rams and goats they were your merchants.
The merchants of Sheba and Raamah were your merchants; with the chief of all spices, and with every precious stone and gold, they furnished your wares.
Haran and Canneh and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad were your merchants.
They were your merchants in choice garments, in cloaks of blue and embroidered work, and in chests of rich apparel, bound with cords and carefully packed, in your market.
The ships of Tarshish were your caravans for your merchandise, and you were filled and made very glorious in the heart of the seas.
In many waters your rowers have brought you; the east wind has broken you in the heart of the seas.

Your wealth and your wares, your merchandise, your sailors and your pilots, those who repair your seams, and the dealers in your merchandise, and all the men of war who are in you, with all your assembly that is in your midst, shall fall into the heart of the seas in the day of your downfall.
At the sound of the cry of your sailors the open fields shall quake.
And all who handle the oar shall come down from their ships; the sailors, all the mariners of the sea, shall stand upon the land.
And they shall lift up their voice over you and cry bitterly; they shall cast dust upon their heads, they shall wallow themselves in ashes.
They shall make themselves utterly bald for you, and gird themselves with sackcloth, and they shall weep for you with bitter soul, with a very bitter mourning.
And they shall lift up over you a lamentation, and shall wail for you, saying, Who is like Tyre, silenced in the midst of the sea?
When your merchandise went forth from the seas, you satisfied many peoples; with the abundance of your wealth and your wares you enriched the kings of the earth.
Now that you are broken by the seas in the depths of the waters, your merchandise and all your company in your midst have fallen.
All the inhabitants of the coastlands are appalled at you, and their kings shudder with horror; their faces tremble.
The merchants among the peoples hissed at you; you have become terrors, and you shall be no more forever.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, Thus says the Lord GOD: Because your heart is lifted up, and you have said, I am a god, I sit in the seat of God in the heart of the seas; yet you are a man and not God, though you set your heart as the heart of God.
Behold, you are wiser than Daniel; no secret is hidden from you.
By your wisdom and by your understanding you have made wealth for yourself, and you have made gold and silver in your treasuries.
By the greatness of your wisdom in your trading you have increased your wealth, and your heart was lifted up because of your wealth.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Because you have set your heart as the heart of a god,
Therefore, behold, I am bringing strangers upon you, the ruthless of the nations; and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, and they shall profane your splendor.
To the pit they shall bring you down, and you shall die the deaths of the slain in the heart of the seas.
Will you indeed say, “I am a god,” before him who slays you? Yet you are a man and not God, in the hand of those who profane you.
The death of the uncircumcised you shall die by the hand of foreigners, for I have spoken, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, take up a lamentation over the king of Tyre, and say to him, Thus says the Lord GOD: You are the seal of perfection, full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

In Eden, the garden of God, you were; every precious stone was your covering: sardius, topaz, and diamond, beryl, onyx, and jasper, sapphire, emerald, and carbuncle, and gold. The workmanship of your timbrels and of your settings was in you; on the day you were created they were prepared.
You were the anointed cherub who covers, and I set you so; you were on the holy mountain of God, you walked in the midst of stones of fire.
You were blameless in your ways from the day you were created, until unrighteousness was found in you.

In the multitude of your trade they filled your midst with violence, and you sinned; therefore I profaned you from the mountain of God, and I destroyed you, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.
Your heart was lifted up because of your beauty; you corrupted your wisdom on account of your splendor. I cast you to the earth; before kings I set you, to gaze upon you.

By the multitude of your iniquities, in the unrighteousness of your trading, you profaned your sanctuaries; and I brought forth fire from your midst, it consumed you, and I made you to be ashes upon the earth in the sight of all who see you.
All who know you among the peoples are appalled at you; you have become terrors, and you shall be no more forever.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her.

And you shall say, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, O Sidon, and I will be glorified in your midst; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I execute judgments in her, and I am sanctified in her.
And I will send pestilence into her, and blood in her streets; and the slain shall fall in the midst of her, by the sword upon her on every side; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And there shall no more be to the house of Israel a pricking brier or a painful thorn from all who are round about them, who despise them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.

Thus says the Lord GOD: When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they have been scattered, and I am sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then they shall dwell upon their own land which I gave to My servant Jacob.

And they shall dwell upon it securely, and shall build houses and plant vineyards, and shall dwell securely, when I execute judgments upon all those who despise them round about them; and they shall know that I am the LORD their God.
In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.

Speak, and say, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lies in the midst of his Nile channels, who has said, My Nile is mine, and I have made it for myself.

And I will put hooks in your jaws, and I will cause the fish of your rivers to cling to your scales, and I will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, and all the fish of your rivers shall cling to your scales.

And I will cast you into the wilderness, you and all the fish of your rivers; upon the face of the field you shall fall, you shall not be gathered nor collected; to the beast of the earth and to the bird of the heavens I have given you for food.
And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the LORD, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
When they grasped you by the hand, you were crushed, and you tore for them every shoulder; and when they leaned upon you, you broke, and you made all their loins to shake.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am bringing a sword upon you, and I will cut off from you man and beast.
And the land of Egypt shall be a desolation and a waste, and they shall know that I am the LORD, because he has said, “The Nile is mine, and I myself have made it.”
Therefore, behold, I am against you and against your rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter desolation, a waste and a ruin, from Migdol to Syene, even to the border of Cush.
No human foot shall pass through it, nor shall the foot of beast pass through it, and it shall not be inhabited forty years.

And I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of desolated lands, and her cities, in the midst of ruined cities, shall be a desolation forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them through the countries.
For thus says the Lord GOD: At the end of forty years I will gather Egypt from the peoples among whom they were scattered.
And I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and bring them back to the land of Pathros, to the land of their origin, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
Among the kingdoms it shall be the lowliest; it shall no more exalt itself above the nations, and I will make them few, so that they shall not rule over the nations.
And it shall no more be for the house of Israel a trust that brings iniquity to remembrance, when they turn after them; and they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
And it came to pass in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army serve a great service against Tyre; every head was made bald, and every shoulder was rubbed bare, yet he and his army had no wages from Tyre for the service that he served against it.

Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am giving to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon the land of Egypt, and he shall carry off her multitude, and seize her spoil, and plunder her prey, and it shall be wages for his army.
As wages for his labor which he performed against her, I have given him the land of Egypt, because they worked for me, declares the Lord GOD.
In that day I will cause a horn to spring forth for the house of Israel, and I will give you an open mouth in the midst of them, and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
Son of man, prophesy and say, Thus says the Lord GOD: Wail, “Alas for the day!”
For the day is near, indeed the day of the LORD is near; a day of cloud, it shall be the time of the nations.
And a sword shall come into Egypt, and anguish shall be in Cush, when the slain fall in Egypt, and they take away her multitude, and her foundations are overthrown.
Cush, and Put, and Lud, and all the mingled people, and Cub, and the children of the land of the covenant with them, shall fall by the sword.
Thus says the LORD: The supporters of Egypt shall fall, and the pride of her strength shall come down; from Migdol to Syene they shall fall within her by the sword, declares the Lord GOD.
And they shall be desolate in the midst of desolate lands, and her cities shall be in the midst of ruined cities.
And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I set a fire in Egypt, and all her helpers are broken.
In that day messengers shall go out from before Me in ships to terrify Cush in its security, and trembling shall be upon them in the day of Egypt, for behold, it comes.
Thus says the Lord GOD: I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
He and his people with him, the ruthless of the nations, shall be brought in to destroy the land; and they shall draw their swords against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.
And I will make the rivers dry, and I will sell the land into the hand of the wicked; and I will lay waste the land and all that fills it by the hand of strangers. I, the LORD, have spoken.
Thus says the Lord GOD: I will also destroy the idols and cause the images to cease from Noph, and there shall no more be a prince from the land of Egypt; and I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
And I will make Pathros desolate, and will set a fire in Zoan, and will execute judgments in No.
And I will pour out My fury upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt, and I will cut off the multitude of No.
And I will set a fire in Egypt; Sin shall writhe in travail, and No shall be for breaking open, and Noph shall have adversaries by day.
The young men of Aven and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword, and they shall go into captivity.

And in Tahpanhes the day shall be dark, when I break there the yokes of Egypt, and the pride of her strength shall cease in her; as for her, a cloud shall cover her, and her daughters shall go into captivity.
And I will execute judgments in Egypt, and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and behold, it has not been bound up, to apply healing remedies, to put on a bandage to bind it, to strengthen it to grasp the sword.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and I will break his arms, the strong one and the one that is broken, and I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
And I will scatter Egypt among the nations, and will disperse them through the lands.

And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and I will put My sword in his hand; but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan with the groanings of one mortally wounded before him.

And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fall; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he stretches it out against the land of Egypt.
And I will scatter Egypt among the nations, and will disperse them through the lands; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his multitude: To whom are you likened in your greatness?
Behold, Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon, fair of branches, with a shadowing thicket, and of high stature, and its top was among the thick boughs.
Waters made it grow, the deep set it on high; her rivers went round about her planting, and she sent out her channels to all the trees of the field.
Therefore his height was exalted above all the trees of the field, and his boughs multiplied, and his branches grew long because of the many waters when they were sent forth.
In its branches all the birds of the heavens made their nests, and beneath its boughs all the beasts of the field brought forth their young, and in its shade dwelt all great nations.
Thus was he fair in his greatness, in the length of his branches, for his root was by many waters.
Cedars in the garden of God could not overshadow it; cypresses were not like its boughs, and plane trees were not as its branches; no tree in the garden of God resembled it in its beauty.
I made it beautiful in the multitude of its branches, and all the trees of Eden that were in the garden of God envied it.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Because you have lifted yourself up in stature, and he has set his top among the thick boughs, and his heart was exalted in his height.
And I will give him into the hand of the mighty one of the nations; he shall surely deal with him. According to his wickedness I have driven him out.

And strangers, the ruthless of the nations, cut him off and left him; upon the mountains and in all the valleys his branches fell, and his boughs were broken in all the channels of the land, and all the peoples of the earth went down from his shadow and left him.
Upon its fallen trunk all the birds of the heavens shall dwell, and upon its branches shall be all the beasts of the field.

In order that none of the trees by the waters should exalt themselves in their stature, nor set their treetops among the thick boughs, nor should any that drink water stand upon them in their height; for they are all delivered to death, to the lower earth, in the midst of the children of man, to those who go down to the pit.

Thus says the Lord GOD: In the day when he went down to Sheol I caused mourning; I covered the deep over him, and I restrained its rivers, and the great waters were held back; and I clothed Lebanon with gloom for him, and all the trees of the field fainted over him.

At the sound of its fall I made the nations tremble, when I brought it down to Sheol with those who go down to the pit; and in the lowest parts of the earth all the trees of Eden were comforted, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water.
They also went down with him to Sheol, to those slain by the sword; and his arm who dwelt in his shadow among the nations.

To whom are you thus likened in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? Yet you shall be brought down with the trees of Eden to the lowest parts of the earth; in the midst of the uncircumcised you shall lie, with those slain by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, declares the Lord GOD.
And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying,

Son of man, lift up a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say to him, You likened yourself to a young lion of the nations, yet you are like the sea monsters in the seas; and you thrust about in your rivers, and troubled the waters with your feet, and fouled their rivers.
Thus says the Lord GOD: I will spread My net over you with a company of many peoples, and they shall haul you up in My dragnet.
And I will cast you upon the land, I will hurl you upon the open field, and I will cause all the birds of the heavens to dwell upon you, and I will satisfy from you every beast of the whole earth.
And I will lay your flesh upon the mountains, and fill the valleys with your height.
And I will water the land with your flowing blood upon the mountains, and the channels shall be filled from you.
And when I cover the heavens, I will darken their stars; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon shall not give its light.
All the bright lights of heaven will I darken over you, and I will set darkness upon your land, declares the Lord GOD.
And I will vex the hearts of many peoples, when I bring your ruin among the nations, upon lands that you have not known.

And I will make many peoples appalled at you, and their kings shall shudder over you in horror, when I brandish my sword before them; and they shall tremble every moment, each for his own life, in the day of your downfall.
For thus says the Lord GOD: The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.
By the swords of the mighty I will cause your multitude to fall, all of them the ruthless of the nations; and they shall despoil the pride of Egypt, and all her multitude shall be destroyed.
And I will destroy all her cattle from beside many waters, and no foot of man shall trouble them anymore, nor shall the hooves of cattle trouble them.
Then will I cause their waters to sink, and their rivers I will make flow like oil, declares the Lord GOD.
When I make the land of Egypt a desolation and a waste, a land stripped of its fullness, when I strike down all who dwell in it, then they shall know that I am the LORD.
A lamentation it is, and the daughters of the nations shall lament her; over Egypt and over all her multitude they shall lament her, declares the Lord GOD.
And it came to pass in the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
Son of man, wail over the multitude of Egypt, and bring it down, her and the daughters of mighty nations, to the lowest parts of the earth, with those who go down to the pit.
Whom do you surpass in beauty? Go down, and be laid with the uncircumcised.
In the midst of the slain by the sword they shall fall; the sword is given, draw her down, and all her multitude.
The mighty ones shall speak to him from the midst of Sheol, with his helpers: they have gone down, they lie with the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.
There is Asshur and all her company; his graves are round about him, all of them slain, those who fell by the sword.
Whose graves are set in the uttermost parts of the pit, and her company is round about her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who caused terror in the land of the living.

There is Elam and all her multitude round about her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who went down uncircumcised to the lower parts of the earth, who caused their terror in the land of the living, and they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.

In the midst of the slain they have set her a resting place, with all her multitude; her graves are round about her, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, for their terror was given forth in the land of the living, and they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit; in the midst of the slain she is put.
There is Meshech, Tubal, and all her multitude, their graves round about them; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, because they spread their terror in the land of the living.

And they shall not lie with the mighty, fallen from among the uncircumcised, who went down to Sheol with their weapons of war, and they laid their swords under their heads, and their iniquities were upon their bones, for they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
And you, in the midst of the uncircumcised you shall be broken, and you shall lie with those slain by the sword.
There is Edom, her kings and all her princes, who in their might were laid with those slain by the sword; they lie with the uncircumcised, and with those who go down to the pit.

There are the princes of the north, all of them, and all the Sidonians, who went down with the slain, ashamed of the terror they caused by their might; and they lie uncircumcised with those slain by the sword, and bear their disgrace with those who go down to the pit.
Pharaoh shall see them and shall be comforted over all his multitude, Pharaoh and all his army slain by the sword, declares the Lord GOD.
For I have set My terror in the land of the living; yet he shall be laid in the midst of the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword—Pharaoh and all his multitude, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

Son of man, speak to the children of your people and say to them, When I bring the sword upon a land, and the people of the land take a man from among their borders and set him for themselves as a watchman,
and he sees the sword coming upon the land, and blows the trumpet and warns the people.
Then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet and does not take warning, and the sword comes and takes him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
He heard the sound of the trumpet and did not take warning; his blood shall be upon himself. But he who takes warning shall deliver his soul.

But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet, and the people are not warned, and the sword comes and takes a life from among them, he is taken away in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at the watchman’s hand.
And you, son of man, I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; and you shall hear the word from My mouth, and you shall warn them from Me.

When I say to the wicked, “O wicked man, you shall surely die,” and you do not speak to warn the wicked from his way, that wicked man shall die in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at your hand.
But if you have warned the wicked man from his way, to turn from it, and he does not turn from his way, he shall die in his iniquity, but you have delivered your soul.
And you, son of man, say to the house of Israel: Thus you have spoken, saying, “Surely our transgressions and our sins are upon us, and in them we are wasting away; and how then can we live?”

Say to them, As I live, declares the Lord GOD, I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that the wicked turn from his way and live. Turn back, turn back from your evil ways; for why will you die, O house of Israel?

And you, son of man, say to the children of your people: The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression, and as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not stumble because of it in the day he turns from his wickedness; nor shall the righteous be able to live by it in the day that he sins.

When I say to the righteous, “He shall surely live,” and he trusts in his righteousness and commits iniquity, none of his righteous deeds shall be remembered, but in the iniquity that he has committed, in it he shall die.
And when I say to the wicked, You shall surely die, and he turns from his sin and does justice and righteousness,
If the wicked restores the pledge, repays what he has robbed, walks in the statutes of life, so as not to commit iniquity, he shall surely live, he shall not die.
None of his sins that he has sinned shall be remembered against him; he has practiced justice and righteousness; he shall surely live.
And the children of your people say, “The way of the Lord is not just,” but it is their own way that is not just.
When the righteous turns back from his righteousness and commits iniquity, he shall die in them.
And when the wicked turns from his wickedness and does justice and righteousness, he shall live by them.
Yet you say, “The way of the Lord is not right.” I will judge each one of you according to his ways, O house of Israel.
And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our exile, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, that the fugitive from Jerusalem came to me, saying, “The city has been struck down.”
Now the hand of the LORD had been upon me in the evening, before the fugitive came; and He opened my mouth until he came to me in the morning, and my mouth was opened, and I was no longer mute.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, the inhabitants of these ruins in the land of Israel are saying, saying, “Abraham was one, yet he inherited the land; but we are many, to us the land has been given for a possession.”
Therefore say to them, Thus says the Lord GOD: You eat with the blood, and you lift up your eyes to your idols, and you shed blood—yet shall you possess the land?
You have stood upon your swords, you have done abomination, and each man has defiled his neighbor’s wife; and shall you possess the land?

Thus you shall say to them, Thus says the Lord GOD: As I live, surely those who are in the ruins shall fall by the sword, and whoever is in the open field I have given to the beast for food, and those who are in the strongholds and in the caves shall die by pestilence.
And I will make the land a desolation and a waste, and the pride of her strength shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, with none passing through.
And they shall know that I am the LORD, when I make the land a desolation and a waste for all their abominations which they have committed.

As for you, son of man, the children of your people speak of you beside the walls and in the doorways of the houses, and one speaks with another, each with his brother, saying, “Come now, and hear what the word is that comes forth from the LORD.”

They come to you as a people comes, and they sit before you as My people, and they hear your words, but they will not do them; for with their mouth they show love, but after their gain their heart goes.
And behold, you are to them as a song of love, one with a beautiful voice and skilled in playing; and they hear your words, but they do not do them.
And when it comes—behold, it comes—then they shall know that a prophet has been among them.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy and say to them, to the shepherds, Thus says the Lord GOD: Woe to the shepherds of Israel who have been shepherding themselves! Should not the shepherds shepherd the flock?
The fat you eat, and the wool you clothe yourselves with; the fattened you slaughter, but the flock you do not feed.

The weak you have not strengthened, the sick you have not healed, the broken you have not bound up, the driven away you have not brought back, and the lost you have not sought; but with force and with harshness you have ruled them.
And they were scattered, because there was no shepherd; and they became food for every beast of the field, and were scattered.
My sheep stray upon all the mountains and upon every high hill; over all the face of the earth My sheep are scattered, and there is none who searches and none who seeks.
Therefore, O shepherds, hear the word of the LORD.

As I live, declares the Lord GOD, surely because My flock became a prey, and My flock became food for all the beasts of the field for lack of a shepherd, and My shepherds did not seek My flock, but the shepherds fed themselves and did not feed My flock.
Therefore, O shepherds, hear the word of the LORD.

Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will require my flock at their hand and cause them to cease from feeding the flock; and the shepherds shall feed themselves no more. And I will deliver my flock from their mouth, and they shall not be food for them.
For thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I, even I, will search for My sheep and will seek them out.

As a shepherd seeks out his flock in the day that he is among his scattered sheep, so will I seek out My sheep and will deliver them from all the places where they were scattered in the day of cloud and thick darkness.

And I will bring them out from the peoples, and gather them from the lands, and I will bring them into their own soil; and I will feed them upon the mountains of Israel, by the watercourses, and in all the inhabited places of the land.

In a good pasture I will feed them, and on the high mountains of Israel shall be their fold; there they shall lie down in a good fold, and in rich pasture they shall feed upon the mountains of Israel.
I Myself will shepherd My flock, and I Myself will cause them to lie down, declares the Lord GOD.
The lost I will seek, and the driven away I will bring back, and the broken I will bind up, and the sick I will strengthen; but the fat and the strong I will destroy. I will feed them with justice.
And as for you, My flock, thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am judging between sheep and sheep, between the rams and the he-goats.
Is it a small thing for you to feed on the good pasture, but the rest of your pastures you trample with your feet, and to drink of settled waters, but the remainder you foul with your feet?
And as for My flock, that which your feet have trampled you pasture, and that which your feet have muddied you drink.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD to them: Behold, I, even I, will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
Because with side and with shoulder you thrust, and with your horns you gore all the weak, until you have scattered them abroad.
And I will save My flock, and they shall no more be for a prey; and I will judge between sheep and sheep.
And I will set up over them one shepherd, and he shall feed them, my servant David; he shall feed them, and he shall be their shepherd.
And I, the LORD, will be God to them, and My servant David a prince in their midst; I, the LORD, have spoken.
And I will cut with them a covenant of peace, and I will cause the evil beast to cease out of the land, and they shall dwell in the wilderness securely, and sleep in the forests.
And I will make them and the places round about My hill a blessing; and I will cause the shower to come down in its season—showers of blessing shall they be.

And the tree of the field shall give its fruit, and the earth shall give her increase, and they shall dwell upon their land in safety; and they shall know that I am the LORD, when I break the bars of their yoke and deliver them out of the hand of those who enslaved them.
And they shall no more be a prey to the nations, and the beast of the earth shall not devour them; but they shall dwell securely, and none shall make them afraid.
And I will raise up for them a planting for renown, and they shall no more be gathered up for famine in the land, nor shall they bear any more the reproach of the nations.
And they shall know that I, the LORD their God, am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are My people, declares the Lord GOD.
And you are My sheep, the sheep of My pasture; you are man, and I am your God, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir, and prophesy against it.
And say to it, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, Mount Seir, and I will stretch out My hand against you, and I will make you a desolation and a waste.
Your cities I will make a desolation, and you shall be a waste, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
Because you have had an everlasting enmity, and have delivered the children of Israel over to the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time of the iniquity of the end.
Therefore, as I live, declares the Lord GOD, surely I will make you blood, and blood shall pursue you; since you have not hated bloodshed, therefore blood shall pursue you.
And I will make Mount Seir a desolation and a waste, and I will cut off from it him that passes through and him that returns.
And I will fill your mountains with your slain; and your hills and your valleys and all your ravines shall be filled with those slain by the sword who fall in them.
I will make you everlasting desolations, and your cities shall not be inhabited; and you shall know that I am the LORD.
Because you have said, “These two nations and these two lands shall be mine, and we will possess it,” though the LORD was there.

Therefore, as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will deal according to your anger and according to your jealousy which you showed out of your hatred against them; and I will make Myself known among them when I judge you.
And you shall know that I am the LORD, for I have heard all your blasphemies which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, “They are laid desolate, they are given to us to devour.”
And you magnified yourselves against Me with your mouth, and multiplied your words against Me; I have heard it.
Thus says the Lord GOD: As all the earth rejoices, I will make you a desolation.

As you rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel because it was desolate, so will I do to you: you shall be a desolation, O Mount Seir, and all Edom, all of it; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And you, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, and say, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the LORD.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Because the enemy has said against you, “Aha! Even the ancient high places have become our possession,”

Therefore prophesy and say, Thus says the Lord GOD: Because, because they have made you desolate and swallowed you up on every side, that you might be a possession to the remnant of the nations, and you are taken up upon the lips of talkers and are an evil report of the people.

Therefore, O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD: Thus says the Lord GOD to the mountains and to the hills, to the ravines and to the valleys, to the desolate ruins and to the forsaken cities, which have become a prey and a derision to the remnant of the nations that are all around.

Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Surely in the fire of My jealousy I have spoken against the remnant of the nations, and against all Edom, who gave My land to themselves for a possession, with rejoicing of all the heart, with utter contempt of soul, to make its open country a prey.

Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel, and say to the mountains and to the hills, to the ravines and to the valleys, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, in My zeal and in My fury I have spoken, because you have borne the reproach of the nations.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: I have lifted up My hand, surely the nations that are around you, they shall bear their own shame.
But you, O mountains of Israel, you shall put forth your branches and bear your fruit for My people Israel, for they are soon to come.
For behold, I am for you, and I will turn toward you, and you shall be tilled and sown.
And I will multiply upon you man, all the house of Israel, all of it; and the cities shall be inhabited, and the ruins shall be rebuilt.

And I will multiply upon you man and beast, and they shall increase and be fruitful; and I will cause you to dwell as in your former times, and I will do better to you than at your beginnings, and you shall know that I am the LORD.
And I will cause men to walk upon you, My people Israel, and they shall possess you, and you shall be their inheritance; and you shall no more again bereave them.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Because they say of you, “You are a devourer of men, and you have been a bereaver of your nations.”
Therefore you shall no more devour mankind, and you shall no more cause your nations to stumble, declares the Lord GOD.
And I will not make you hear any more the shame of the nations, and the reproach of the peoples you shall bear no more; and your nations you shall no more cause to stumble, declares the Lord GOD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
Son of man, the house of Israel, when they dwelt upon their own land, defiled it by their way and by their deeds; their way before Me was as the uncleanness of a woman in her impurity.
So I poured out My fury upon them, for the blood which they had shed upon the land, and with their idols they defiled it.
And I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed through the lands; according to their way and according to their deeds I judged them.
And they came to the nations, wherever they came, and they profaned My holy name, when it was said of them, “These are the people of the LORD, and from His land they have gone out.”
But I had compassion for My holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations to which they came.

Therefore say to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord GOD: It is not for your sake that I act, O house of Israel, but for My holy name which you have profaned among the nations where you have gone.

And I will sanctify My great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in the midst of them; and the nations shall know that I am the LORD, declares the Lord GOD, when I am sanctified in you before their eyes.
And I will take you from among the nations, and gather you out of all the lands, and will bring you into your own land.
And I will sprinkle clean water upon you, and you shall be clean; from all your uncleannesses and from all your idols I will cleanse you.
And I will give you a new heart, and a new spirit will I put within you; and I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh, and I will give you a heart of flesh.
And I will put My Spirit within you, and I will cause you to walk in My statutes, and you shall keep My judgments and do them.
And you shall dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers, and you shall be My people, and I will be your God.
And I will save you from all your uncleannesses, and I will call for the grain and multiply it, and I will not bring famine upon you.
And I will multiply the fruit of the tree and the increase of the field, so that you shall no more bear the reproach of famine among the nations.
Then you will remember your evil ways and your deeds that were not good, and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations.
Not for your sake am I acting, declares the Lord GOD; let it be known to you. Be ashamed and confounded because of your ways, O house of Israel.
Thus says the Lord GOD: In the day that I cleanse you from all your iniquities, I will cause the cities to be inhabited, and the ruins shall be rebuilt.
And the desolate land shall be tilled, whereas it was a waste, in the sight of all who pass by.
And they shall say, This land that was desolate has become like the garden of Eden, and the waste and desolate and ruined cities are fortified and inhabited.
And the nations that are left all around you shall know that I, the LORD, have built the ruined places and planted that which was desolate. I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will do it.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Again I will be inquired of by the house of Israel, to do this for them; I will multiply them as the flock of men.
Like the flock of holy offerings, like the flock of Jerusalem in her appointed feasts, so shall the waste cities be filled with flocks of men; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
The hand of the LORD was upon me, and He brought me out in the Spirit of the LORD and set me down in the midst of the valley, and it was full of bones.
And He caused me to pass by them all around, and behold, they were very many upon the surface of the valley; and behold, they were very dry.
And He said to me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I said, O Lord GOD, You know.
And He said to me, Prophesy over these bones, and say to them, O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD.
Thus says the Lord GOD to these bones: Behold, I am bringing breath into you, and you shall live.
And I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and will cover you with skin, and I will put breath in you, and you shall live; and you shall know that I am the LORD.
So I prophesied as I was commanded; and as I prophesied, there was a sound, and behold, a rattling, and the bones came together, bone to its bone.
And I looked, and behold, sinews were upon them, and flesh came up, and skin covered them from above; but there was no breath in them.
And He said to me, Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, son of man, and say to the breath, Thus says the Lord GOD: From the four winds come, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.
So I prophesied as He commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood upon their feet, an exceedingly great army.
And He said to me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel. Behold, they say, Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost; we are cut off for ourselves.
Therefore prophesy and say to them, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am opening your graves and I will bring you up out of your graves, O My people, and I will bring you into the land of Israel.
And you shall know that I am the LORD, when I open your graves and bring you up out of your graves, O my people.
And I will put My Spirit within you, and you shall live, and I will set you upon your own soil; and you shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken and I have done it, declares the LORD.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

And you, son of man, take for yourself one stick and write upon it, “For Judah and for the children of Israel his companions”; and take one stick and write upon it, “For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and all the house of Israel his companions.”
And join them one to another for yourself into one stick, and they shall become one in your hand.
And when the children of your people speak to you, saying, “Will you not declare to us what these things are to you?”

Say to them, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am taking the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his companions, and I will put them with it, with the stick of Judah, and I will make them one stick, and they shall be one in My hand.
And the sticks on which you write shall be in your hand before their eyes.

And speak to them, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am taking the children of Israel from among the nations where they have gone, and I will gather them from all around, and I will bring them into their own land.

And I will make them one nation in the land, upon the mountains of Israel, and one king shall be king for them all; and they shall no more be two nations, neither shall they be divided any more into two kingdoms.

And they shall no more defile themselves with their idols, nor with their abominations, nor with any of their transgressions; and I will save them out of all their dwelling places wherein they have sinned, and will purify them, and they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
And My servant David shall be king over them, and there shall be one shepherd for them all; and they shall walk in My judgments, and keep My statutes, and do them.

And they shall dwell in the land that I gave to My servant Jacob, wherein your fathers dwelt; and they shall dwell upon it, they and their children and their children’s children, forever; and David My servant shall be prince over them forever.
And I will cut with them a covenant of peace; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them. And I will set them and multiply them, and I will set My sanctuary in their midst forever.
My dwelling place shall be over them, and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
And the nations shall know that I am the LORD who sanctifies Israel, when My sanctuary is in their midst forever.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
Son of man, set your face toward Gog, of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him.
And you shall say, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal.

And I will turn you about and put hooks in your jaws, and I will bring you out, and all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them clothed in full armor, a great company with buckler and shield, all of them wielding swords.
Persia, Cush, and Put with them, all of them with shield and helmet.
Gomer and all its hordes, the house of Togarmah from the uttermost parts of the north and all its hordes, many peoples with you.
Be prepared and make ready for yourself, you and all your assembly that are gathered about you, and you shall be for them a guard.

After many days you will be mustered; in the latter years you will come into a land restored from the sword, gathered out of many peoples, upon the mountains of Israel which had been a continual desolation; but it has been brought out from the peoples, and they dwell securely, all of them.
You shall go up like a storm; you shall come like a cloud to cover the land, you and all your hordes, and many peoples with you.
Thus says the Lord GOD: And it shall come to pass in that day, that words will arise upon your heart, and you will devise an evil thought.

And you will say, I will go up against the land of unwalled villages; I will come against those who are at rest, who dwell securely, all of them dwelling without wall, and they have neither bar nor gates.

to seize spoil and to carry off plunder, to turn your hand against waste places now inhabited, and against a people gathered out of the nations, who have gotten cattle and goods, who dwell upon the navel of the earth.

Sheba and Dedan and the merchants of Tarshish with all her young lions shall say to you, “Have you come to seize spoil? Have you assembled your company to plunder prey, to carry away silver and gold, to take livestock and goods, to seize great spoil?”
Therefore prophesy, son of man, and say to Gog, Thus says the Lord GOD: On that day, when My people Israel dwell securely, will you not know it?
And you shall come from your place out of the uttermost parts of the north, you and many peoples with you, all of them riding on horses, a great assembly and a mighty army.

And you shall come up against My people Israel like a cloud to cover the land; it shall be in the latter days, and I will bring you against My land, so that the nations may know Me, when I am sanctified through you before their eyes, O Gog.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Are you he of whom I spoke in former days by the hand of My servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days, for years, that I would bring you against them?
And it shall come to pass in that day, in the day when Gog comes against the land of Israel, declares the Lord GOD, that My fury shall come up in My nostrils.
And in My zeal, in the fire of My wrath I have spoken: Surely in that day there shall be a great shaking upon the land of Israel.

And the fish of the sea, and the birds of the heavens, and the beast of the field, and every creeping thing that creeps upon the ground, and all mankind that are upon the face of the earth shall quake at My presence; and the mountains shall be thrown down, and the steep places shall fall, and every wall shall fall to the ground.
And I will summon a sword against him on all My mountains, declares the Lord GOD; every man’s sword shall be against his brother.

And I will enter into judgment with him with pestilence and with blood; and I will rain upon him, and upon his bands, and upon the many peoples that are with him, an overflowing rain, and great hailstones, fire and brimstone.
And I will magnify Myself and sanctify Myself, and I will make Myself known in the sight of many nations; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And you, son of man, prophesy against Gog and say, Thus says the Lord GOD: Behold, I am against you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal.
And I will turn you around and lead you on, and I will bring you up from the uttermost parts of the north, and I will bring you upon the mountains of Israel.
And I will strike your bow from your left hand, and I will cause your arrows to fall from your right hand.

Upon the mountains of Israel you shall fall, you and all your hordes, and the peoples who are with you; to the birds of prey, every winged thing, and to the beasts of the field I have given you for food.
Upon the open field you shall fall, for I have spoken, declares the Lord GOD.
And I will send a fire on Magog, and on those who dwell securely in the coastlands; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
And I will make known My holy name in the midst of My people Israel, and I will not let My holy name be profaned any more; and the nations shall know that I am the LORD, the Holy One in Israel.
Behold, it comes and it shall be fulfilled, declares the Lord GOD; this is the day of which I have spoken.

Then the inhabitants of the cities of Israel shall go out and set fire and kindle with the weapons, both shield and buckler, bow and arrows, handstaff and spear, and they shall make fires with them seven years.

And they shall not take wood from the field, nor cut down any from the forests, for with the weapons they shall kindle fire; and they shall plunder those who plundered them, and spoil those who spoiled them, declares the Lord GOD.

And it shall come to pass in that day that I will give to Gog a place there for a grave in Israel, the valley of those who pass through, on the east of the sea, and it shall block those who pass through; and there they shall bury Gog and all his multitude, and they shall call it The Valley of the Multitude of Gog.
And the house of Israel shall be burying them, in order to cleanse the land, seven months.
All the people of the land shall bury them, and it shall be to them for a name, the day that I am glorified, declares the Lord GOD.

And men of continual employment they shall set apart, who pass through the land to bury with the travelers those who remain upon the face of the land, to cleanse it; at the end of seven months they shall make their search.
And when those who pass through the land pass through, and one sees a human bone, then he shall set up a marker beside it, until the buriers have buried it in the Valley of Hamon-gog.
And also the name of the city shall be Hamonah, and they shall cleanse the land.

And you, son of man, thus says the Lord GOD: Say to every bird of every wing, and to every beast of the field, Gather yourselves and come, assemble yourselves from all around to my sacrifice that I am sacrificing for you, a great sacrifice upon the mountains of Israel, and you shall eat flesh and drink blood.
The flesh of the mighty you shall eat, and the blood of the princes of the earth you shall drink, rams, lambs, and goats, bulls, all of them fatlings of Bashan.
And you shall eat fat till you are satisfied, and drink blood till you are drunk, from My sacrifice that I have sacrificed for you.
And you shall be filled at My table with horse and chariot, with mighty man and with every man of war, declares the Lord GOD.
And I will set My glory among the nations, and all the nations shall see My judgment that I have executed, and My hand that I have laid upon them.
And the house of Israel shall know that I am the LORD their God from that day and onward.

And the nations shall know that the house of Israel went into exile for their iniquity, because they were unfaithful to Me, and I hid My face from them and gave them into the hand of their adversaries, and they all fell by the sword.
According to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions I dealt with them, and I hid My face from them.
Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Now I will restore the fortunes of Jacob, and I will have compassion on all the house of Israel, and I will be zealous for my holy name.
And they shall bear their shame and all their unfaithfulness that they have committed against Me, when they dwell upon their own land securely, and none shall make them afraid.
When I bring them back from the peoples and gather them out of the lands of their enemies, then I will be sanctified through them in the sight of many nations.
And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, when I exile them among the nations and gather them upon their own land, and I will not leave any of them remaining there.
And I will no more hide My face from them, for I have poured out My Spirit upon the house of Israel, declares the Lord GOD.

In the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was struck down, on that very day the hand of the LORD was upon me, and he brought me there.
In visions of God he brought me into the land of Israel, and set me upon a very high mountain, and upon it there was something like the structure of a city on the south.
And he brought me there, and behold, a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze, and a linen cord in his hand, and a measuring reed; and he was standing in the gate.

And the man spoke to me, Son of man, see with your eyes, and hear with your ears, and set your heart upon all that I am showing you; for in order to show you these things you have been brought here. Declare all that you see to the house of Israel.

And behold, a wall was on the outside of the house all around, and in the man’s hand a measuring reed of six cubits, each a cubit and a handbreadth; and he measured the thickness of the building, one reed, and the height, one reed.
Then he came to the gate whose face was toward the east, and he went up by its steps, and measured the threshold of the gate, one reed in width, and the other threshold, one reed in width.

And each guardroom was one measuring reed in length and one reed in width, and between the guardrooms were five cubits; and the threshold of the gate, by the porch of the gate on the inner side, was one measuring reed.
And he measured the porch of the gate from the house, one measuring reed.
And he measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and its jambs, two cubits; and the porch of the gate was inward, toward the house.
And the guardrooms of the gate toward the east were three on this side and three on that side; one measure was to the three of them, and one measure was to the posts on this side and on that side.
And he measured the width of the entrance of the gate, ten cubits; the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
And a border before the guardrooms, one cubit on this side, and one cubit the border on that side; and the guardroom, six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side.
And he measured the gate from the roof of one chamber to the roof of another; the width was twenty and five cubits, door against door.
And he made the pilasters sixty cubits, and to the pilaster of the court of the gate all around, all around.
And from the front of the gate of the entrance to the front of the porch of the inner gate were fifty cubits.
