And there were shuttered windows toward the chambers and toward their posts within the gate all around, and likewise to the vestibules; and there were windows all around within, and on the posts were palm trees.
And he brought me into the outer court, and behold, there were chambers, and a pavement made for the court round about; thirty chambers were upon the pavement round about.
And the pavement ran along the side of the gates, corresponding to the length of the gates—the lower pavement.
And he measured the breadth from before the lower gate to before the inner court, on the outside, a hundred cubits, toward the east and toward the north.
And the gate whose face was toward the way of the north, belonging to the outer court, he measured its length and its breadth.

And its guard-chambers were three on this side and three on that side, and its posts and its porches were after the measure of the first gate; its length was fifty cubits, and its breadth twenty and five cubits.

And its windows, and its colonnades, and its palm trees were according to the measure of the gate whose face is toward the east; and by seven steps they would go up to it, and its vestibules were before them.
And there was a gate to the inner court opposite the gate toward the north and toward the east, and he measured from gate to gate a hundred cubits.
And he led me toward the way of the south, and behold, a gate that faced the way of the south; and he measured its posts and its porches according to these measurements.
And there were windows for it and for its side-chambers all around, like these windows; the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
And its stairway had seven steps, and its porch was before them; and palm trees were on it, one on this side and one on that side, upon its posts.
And there was a gate to the inner court toward the south; and he measured from gate to gate toward the south, a hundred cubits.
And he brought me into the inner court by the south gate, and he measured the south gate according to these measurements.

And its alcoves and its pilasters and its porches were according to these measurements, and there were windows for it and for its porches all around, all around; fifty cubits its length, and the breadth twenty and five cubits.
And the colonnades all around, all around, were twenty-five cubits in length and five cubits in width.
And its colonnades were toward the outer court, and palm trees were upon its posts on this side and on that side, and its stairway had eight steps.
And he brought me into the inner court by the way of the east, and he measured the gate according to these measurements.

And its chambers and its posts and its porches were according to these measurements, and there were windows to it and to its posts round about; the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth twenty‑five cubits.
And its colonnades were toward the outer court, and palm trees were upon its posts on this side and on that side, and its stairway had eight steps.
And he brought me to the north gate, and he measured it according to these measurements.
And its side chambers and its posts and its colonnades, and the windows all around within; the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth twenty-five cubits.
And its jambs were toward the outer court, and palm trees were upon its jambs on this side and on that side, and there were eight steps to its ascent.
And a chamber with its entrance was by the posts of the gates; there they shall wash the burnt offering.
And in the porch of the gate there were two tables on this side and two tables on that side, to slay upon them the burnt offering and the sin offering and the guilt offering.
And at the side outside, as one goes up to the entrance of the north gate, were two tables; and at the other side, which belonged to the porch of the gate, were two tables.
Four tables on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, upon which they shall slaughter.

And four tables for the burnt offering, of hewn stone, a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high; upon them they shall lay the instruments with which they slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
And the ledges, one handbreadth wide, were fixed in the house round about, and upon the tables was the flesh of the offering.

And outside the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner court, which were at the side of the north gate, and their faces were toward the south; one at the side of the east gate, with its face toward the north.
And he spoke to me, This chamber whose face is toward the south is for the priests, keepers of the charge of the house.

And the chamber whose face is toward the north is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar; they are the sons of Zadok, who from among the sons of Levi draw near to the LORD to minister to Him.
And he measured the court, a length of a hundred cubits and a breadth of a hundred cubits, foursquare; and the altar was before the house.

And he brought me to the porch of the house, and he measured the post of the porch, five cubits on this side and five cubits on that side; and the width of the gate, three cubits on this side and three cubits on that side.
The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits; and by steps they went up to it, and there were pillars by the posts, one on this side and one on that side.
And he brought me into the temple, and he measured the posts, six cubits broad on the one side, and six cubits broad on the other side, the breadth of the tent.

And the width of the entrance was ten cubits, and the shoulders of the entrance were five cubits on this side and five cubits on that side; and he measured its length, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits.
And he went inward, and measured the pillar of the entrance, two cubits; and the entrance, six cubits; and the width of the entrance, seven cubits.
And he measured its length, twenty cubits, and its width, twenty cubits, before the temple; and he said to me, This is the Holy of Holies.
And he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of the side-chamber, four cubits, round about, all around the house on every side.

And the side chambers were chamber over chamber, thirty in order; and they entered into the wall which belonged to the house for the side chambers round about, that they might be fastened in it, but they were not fastened in the wall of the house.

And the side chambers became wider and wound higher and higher around, for the winding of the house went upward, higher and higher, all around the house; therefore the width of the house increased upward, and so the lowest went up to the highest through the middle.
And I saw for the house a raised platform round about; the foundations of the side chambers were a full measuring reed, six long cubits.
The thickness of the wall that was for the side-chamber on the outside was five cubits, and that which was left was the place of the side-chambers that belonged to the house.
And between the chambers was a breadth of twenty cubits round about the house, all around, on every side.

And the doorway of the side chamber was toward the free space: one entrance toward the north, and one entrance toward the south; and the width of the place of the free space was five cubits round about, all around.

And the building that was before the separate place on the side toward the west was seventy cubits in breadth; and the wall of the building was five cubits thick round about, round about, and its length was ninety cubits.
And he measured the house, a length of one hundred cubits; and the separate place, and the building with its walls, a length of one hundred cubits.
And the breadth of the front of the house and of the separate place toward the east was a hundred cubits.

And he measured the length of the building that was before the separate place which was behind it, and its galleries on this side and on that side, a hundred cubits, as well as the inner temple and the porches of the court.

The doorframes, and the shuttered windows, and the galleries round about on their three stories, over against the threshold, were paneled with wood round about; and the floor up to the windows, and the windows were covered.
From above the entrance, even to the inner house and outside, and to all the wall round about, on the inside and on the outside, were measurements.
And it was made with cherubim and palm trees, and a palm tree between cherub and cherub, and every cherub had two faces.
And a human face was toward the palm tree on this side, and a young lion’s face toward the palm tree on that side; it was made through all the house round about.
From the ground up to above the entrance, cherubim and palm trees were made, and so was the wall of the temple.
The temple doorposts were squared, and the appearance of the sanctuary was like the appearance.
The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and its length two cubits; and its corners, and its length, and its walls were of wood. And he spoke to me, “This is the table that is before the LORD.”
And two doors were for the temple and for the Holy Place.
And two doors were for the one door, two turning doors; two for the one door, and two doors for the other.
And there were made upon them, upon the doors of the temple, cherubim and palm trees, like those made upon the walls; and a wooden canopy was on the face of the porch outside.
And shuttered windows and palm trees were on this side and on that side, on the shoulders of the porch, and on the side-chambers of the house, and on the projections.
And he brought me out into the outer court, the way toward the north, and he brought me to the chamber that was opposite the separate area and that was opposite the building toward the north.
Before the length of a hundred cubits was the north-facing entrance, and the width was fifty cubits.
Facing the twenty cubits that were for the inner court, and facing the pavement that was for the outer court, was gallery opposite gallery in three stories.
And before the chambers was a walk of ten cubits in breadth inward, a way of one cubit, and their openings were toward the north.
And the upper chambers were shorter, for the galleries took away from them, from the lower and from the middle ones of the building.
For they were in three stories, and they had no pillars like the pillars of the courts; therefore the upper chambers were set back more than the lower and the middle ones from the ground.
And the wall that was outside, alongside the chambers toward the outer court, facing the chambers, its length was fifty cubits.
For the length of the chambers that were in the outer court was fifty cubits, and behold, those before the face of the temple were a hundred cubits.
And from beneath these chambers was the entrance from the east, as one comes to them from the outer court.
In the breadth of the wall of the court toward the east, before the separate area and before the building, there were chambers.

And the way before them was like the appearance of the chambers that were toward the north, as long as they, so wide as they; and all their exits were according to their arrangements, and like their entrances.
And like the entrances of the chambers that were toward the south was an entrance at the head of the way, the way before the wall of the court, toward the east, as one goes in.

And he said to me, The chambers of the north and the chambers of the south, which are before the separate area, these are the holy chambers where the priests who draw near to the LORD shall eat the most holy things; there they shall lay the most holy things, and the grain offering and the sin offering and the guilt offering, for the place is holy.

When the priests enter, then they shall not go out from the holy place into the outer court, but there they shall lay down their garments in which they minister, for they are holy; and they shall put on other garments, and they shall approach that which is for the people.
And when he had finished measuring the inner house, he brought me out by way of the gate whose face is toward the east, and he measured it all around, all around.
He measured the east side with the measuring reed, five hundred reeds with the measuring reed, round about.
He measured the north side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed all around.
He measured the south side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed.
He turned to the west wind and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
He measured it on the four sides; it had a wall all around, the length five hundred and the breadth five hundred, to separate between the holy and the common.
Then he led me to the gate, the gate that faces toward the east.
And behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east, and His voice was like the sound of many waters, and the earth shone with His glory.

And the appearance was like the appearance that I had seen, like the appearance that I had seen when I came to destroy the city; and the visions were like the vision that I had seen by the River Chebar, and I fell upon my face.
And the glory of the LORD came into the house by the way of the gate whose front is toward the east.
And the Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court, and behold, the house was filled with the glory of the LORD.
And I heard Him speaking to me from the house, and a man was standing beside me.

And he said to me, Son of man, this is the place of my throne and the place of the soles of my feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel forever; and the house of Israel shall no more defile my holy name, they and their kings, by their whoredom and by the corpses of their kings in their high places.

When they set their threshold by my threshold, and their doorpost beside my doorpost, with only the wall between me and them, they profaned my holy name by their abominations that they committed; therefore I consumed them in my anger.
Now let them put far away their harlotry and the carcasses of their kings from Me, and I will dwell in their midst forever.
You, son of man, declare to the house of Israel the house, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities, and let them measure the pattern.

And if they are ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the form of the house, and its arrangement, and its exits, and its entrances, and all its forms, and all its statutes, and all its formations, and all its laws; and write it before their eyes, that they may keep all its form and all its statutes, and do them.
This is the law of the house: upon the top of the mountain all its border round about shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.

And these are the measurements of the altar by cubits, the cubit being a cubit and a handbreadth: its base shall be a cubit, and a cubit in width, and its border by its edge round about a span; and this is the height of the altar.
And from the bosom of the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the small ledge to the great ledge, four cubits, and the breadth one cubit.
And the altar hearth shall be four cubits high, and from the altar hearth and upward the horns shall be four.
And the altar hearth shall be twelve long by twelve wide, square in its four sides.

And the ledge shall be fourteen cubits in length by fourteen in breadth on its four sides; and the border around it shall be half a cubit, and its base a cubit all around, and its steps shall face east.
And he said to me, Son of man, thus says the Lord GOD: These are the statutes of the altar on the day when it is made, to offer burnt offering upon it and to sprinkle blood upon it.
And you shall give to the priests the Levites, who are of the seed of Zadok, who draw near to Me, declares the Lord GOD, to minister to Me, a young bull of the herd for a sin offering.
And you shall take some of its blood and put it on its four horns, and on the four corners of the ledge, and on the border all around; so you shall cleanse it and make atonement for it.
And you shall take the bull of the sin offering, and burn it in the appointed place of the house, outside the sanctuary.
And on the second day you shall offer a male goat without blemish for a sin offering, and they shall purify the altar as they purified it with the bull.
When you have finished purging it, you shall bring near a young bull of the herd without blemish, and a ram from the flock without blemish.
And you shall bring them near before the LORD, and the priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up as a burnt offering to the LORD.
Seven days you shall prepare a male goat for a sin offering each day, and a young bull and a ram from the flock, without blemish, they shall prepare.
Seven days they shall make atonement for the altar and purify it, and so consecrate it.

And when they have completed these days, it shall be that on the eighth day and onward the priests shall offer upon the altar your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, and I will accept you, declares the Lord GOD.
And he brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary which faces east, and it was shut.
And the LORD said to me, This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, because the LORD, the God of Israel, has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.
As for the prince, the prince, he shall sit in it to eat bread before the LORD; he shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate, and by the same way he shall go out.
And he brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the house; and I looked, and behold, the glory of the LORD filled the house of the LORD, and I fell upon my face.

And the LORD said to me, Son of man, set your heart, and see with your eyes, and with your ears hear all that I speak with you concerning all the statutes of the house of the LORD, and all its laws; and set your heart to the entrance of the house, with all the exits of the sanctuary.
And you shall say to the rebellious, to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord GOD: Enough of you, from all your abominations, O house of Israel.

In that you brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary, to profane it, even My house, when you offered My food, the fat and the blood, and they broke My covenant, in addition to all your abominations.
And you have not kept the charge of My holy things, but you have appointed others to keep the charge of My sanctuary for you.
Thus says the Lord GOD: No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into My sanctuary, any foreigner who is among the children of Israel.
But the Levites who went far from Me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from Me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.

And they shall be ministers in My sanctuary, officers at the gates of the house and ministers of the house; they shall slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister to them.

Because they ministered to them before their idols and became to the house of Israel a stumbling block of iniquity, therefore I have lifted up My hand against them, declares the Lord GOD, and they shall bear their iniquity.

And they shall not come near to Me, to serve Me as priest, nor to come near to any of My holy things, to the most holy things; but they shall bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed.
And I will appoint them to keep the charge of the house, for all its service and for all that shall be done in it.

But the Levitical priests, the sons of Zadok, who kept the charge of My sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from Me, they shall come near to Me to minister to Me, and they shall stand before Me to offer to Me the fat and the blood, declares the Lord GOD.
They shall enter into My sanctuary, and they shall come near to My table, to minister to Me, and they shall keep My charge.

And it shall be, when they enter at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments, and no wool shall come upon them while they minister in the gates of the inner court and within the house.
Linen turbans shall be upon their heads, and linen breeches shall be upon their loins; they shall not gird themselves so as to cause sweat.

And when they go out to the outer court, to the outer court to the people, they shall put off their garments wherein they ministered, and lay them in the holy chambers, and they shall put on other garments, so that they do not sanctify the people with their garments.
And they shall not shave their heads, nor let their hair grow long; they shall surely trim the hair of their heads.
And no priest shall drink wine when they enter into the inner court.
And they shall not take for themselves a widow or a divorced woman as wives, but only virgins of the seed of the house of Israel; and the widow who is a widow of a priest they may take.
And they shall teach My people the difference between the holy and the common, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
In a dispute they shall stand to judge; according to My judgments they shall judge it. My laws and My statutes in all My appointed times they shall keep, and My Sabbaths they shall sanctify.

And to a dead person he shall not come, to defile himself; except for father or for mother, and for son and for daughter, for brother, and for a sister who has not been with a man, for these he may defile himself.
And after his cleansing, they shall count for him seven days.
And on the day when he comes into the sanctuary, into the inner court to minister in the sanctuary, he shall present his sin offering, declares the Lord GOD.
And it shall be to them for an inheritance: I am their inheritance. And you shall give them no possession in Israel; I am their possession.
The grain offering, and the sin offering, and the guilt offering, they shall eat them; and every devoted thing in Israel shall be theirs.

And the first of all the firstfruits of everything, and every contribution of all that you lift up, of all your contributions, shall be for the priests; and the first of your dough you shall give to the priest, to cause a blessing to rest upon your house.
Any carcass or that which is torn, of bird or of beast, the priests shall not eat.

And when you allot the land as an inheritance, you shall set apart an offering to the LORD, a holy portion from the land: the length shall be twenty-five thousand in length, and the width ten thousand; it shall be holy in all its border all around.
Of this there shall be for the holy place five hundred by five hundred, square all around, and fifty cubits of open land for it all around.
From this measurement you shall measure a length of twenty-five thousand and a width of ten thousand, and within it shall be the sanctuary, the Most Holy Place.

It is a holy portion from the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to the LORD, and it shall be a place for houses for them, and a holy place for the sanctuary.
And five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth, shall be for the Levites, the ministers of the house, for a possession to them, with twenty chambers.
And as the possession of the city you shall give five thousand in breadth, and five and twenty thousand in length, over against the holy contribution; it shall be for all the house of Israel.

And for the prince shall be on this side and on that side of the holy contribution and of the possession of the city, over against the front of the holy contribution and the front of the city’s possession, from the west side westward and from the east side eastward; and in length it shall be alongside one of the portions, from the west border to the east border.
The land shall be to him for a possession in Israel, and My princes shall no more oppress My people; and the land they shall give to the house of Israel according to their tribes.
Thus says the Lord GOD: Enough for you, princes of Israel! Put away violence and spoil, and practice justice and righteousness. Remove your evictions from upon My people, declares the Lord GOD.
Just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath shall be yours.
The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, so that the bath may contain a tenth of a homer, and the ephah a tenth of a homer; according to the homer shall be its standard.
And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh.
This is the offering that you shall lift up: a sixth of an ephah from a homer of wheat, and you shall give a sixth of an ephah from a homer of barley.
And the ordinance of the oil: the bath of oil is the tithe of the bath out of the cor, ten baths to the homer; for ten baths are a homer.

And one lamb from the flock, out of two hundred, from the well-watered pastures of Israel, for a grain offering, and for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make atonement for them, declares the Lord GOD.
All the people of the land shall be bound to this offering for the prince in Israel.

And upon the prince shall be the burnt offerings, and the grain offering, and the drink offering, in the feasts, and in the new moons, and in the sabbaths, in all the appointed times of the house of Israel; he shall prepare the sin offering, and the grain offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.
Thus says the Lord GOD: In the first month, on the first of the month, you shall take a young bull of the herd without blemish and purify the sanctuary.

And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering and put it upon the doorpost of the house, and upon the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and upon the doorpost of the gate of the inner court.
And so you shall do on the seventh day of the month for anyone who errs and for the simple, and you shall make atonement for the house.
In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, the Passover shall be for you, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
And on that day the prince shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.

And the seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to the LORD, seven bulls and seven rams without blemish for each day of the seven days, and a male goat of the goats for a sin offering for each day.
And as a grain offering, an ephah for a bull and an ephah for a ram shall he prepare, and of oil a hin for an ephah.

In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, at the feast, he shall do the like for seven days, as with the sin offering, as with the burnt offering, and as with the grain offering, and as with the oil.
Thus says the Lord GOD: The gate of the inner court that faces east shall be shut the six working days, but on the Sabbath day it shall be opened, and on the day of the new moon it shall be opened.

And the prince shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate from outside, and shall stand by the post of the gate; and the priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall bow himself at the threshold of the gate, and then go out; and the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
And the people of the land shall worship at the entrance of that gate on the Sabbaths and on the new moons before the LORD.
And the burnt offering that the prince shall bring to the LORD on the sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish, and a ram without blemish.
And a grain offering of an ephah for the ram, and for the lambs a grain offering as his hand is able to give, and of oil a hin to an ephah.
And on the day of the new moon, a young bull of the herd without blemish, and six lambs and a ram; they shall be without blemish.
And as a grain offering he shall prepare an ephah for a bull and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs as his hand is able to give, and of oil a hin for each ephah.
And when the prince comes in, by the way of the porch of the gate he shall come in, and by its way he shall go out.

And when the people of the land come before the LORD at the appointed feasts, he who enters by the way of the north gate to worship shall go out by the way of the south gate, and he who enters by the way of the south gate shall go out by the way of the north gate; he shall not return by the way of the gate by which he entered, but shall go out straight before him.
And the prince shall be in their midst; when they go in, he shall go in, and when they go out, they shall go out.
And at the feasts and at the appointed times, the grain offering shall be an ephah for a bull and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs as his hand is able to give, and of oil a hin for an ephah.

And when the prince makes a freewill offering, a burnt offering or peace offerings as a freewill offering to the LORD, the gate that faces east shall be opened for him, and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings as he does on the sabbath day; then he shall go out, and the gate shall be shut after he has gone out.
And a lamb of the first year, without blemish, you shall prepare as a burnt offering for the day to the LORD; morning by morning you shall prepare it.

And you shall prepare a grain offering upon it morning by morning, a sixth of an ephah, and oil, a third of a hin, to moisten the fine flour, a grain offering to the LORD, an everlasting ordinance, continually.
Thus they shall prepare the lamb, and the grain offering, and the oil, morning by morning, as a continual burnt offering.
Thus says the Lord GOD: If the prince gives a gift to any of his sons, it is his inheritance; it shall belong to his sons, it is their possession by inheritance.

But if he gives a gift from his inheritance to one of his servants, it shall be his until the year of liberty; then it shall return to the prince. Only his inheritance shall belong to his sons; it shall be theirs.

And the prince shall not take of the inheritance of the people, to thrust them out from their possession; from his own possession he shall give inheritance to his sons, so that My people be not scattered, each man from his possession.
And he brought me into the entrance which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers for the priests, which faced north; and behold, there was a place at their rear parts, on the west side.

And he said to me, This is the place where the priests shall boil the guilt offering and the sin offering, where they shall bake the grain offering, so that they do not bring them out into the outer court, to sanctify the people.
And he brought me out to the outer court, and he caused me to pass by the four corners of the court; and behold, in every corner of the court there was a court.
In the four corners of the court there were enclosed courts, forty cubits in length and thirty in breadth; one measure was for the four of them, in the four corners.
And there was a row round about in them, round about the four of them, and hearths for boiling were made beneath the rows all around.
And he said to me, These are the houses of the cooks, where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifice of the people.

Then he brought me back to the entrance of the house, and behold, waters were issuing out from beneath the threshold of the house eastward, for the front of the house faced east; and the waters were descending from beneath the right side of the house, south of the altar.
And he brought me out by way of the north gate, and led me around by the way outside to the outer gate, the way that faces east; and behold, waters were gushing out from the right side.
When the man went out eastward with a measuring line in his hand, he measured a thousand cubits and made me pass through the water, water to the ankles.
Again he measured a thousand and made me pass through the water, water to the knees; again he measured a thousand and made me pass through, water to the loins.
And he measured a thousand, and it was a river that I could not pass through, for the waters had risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be crossed.
And he said to me, “Have you seen this, son of man?” Then he led me and brought me back to the bank of the river.
When I returned, behold, on the bank of the river there was a very great multitude of trees on this side and on that side.
And he said to me, “These waters go out toward the eastern region and go down into the Arabah, and they enter the sea; into the sea of the outflow they enter, and the waters shall be healed.”

And it shall be that every living creature that swarms, wherever the streams shall come, shall live; and there shall be very many fish, for these waters have come there and they shall be healed, and everything shall live wherever the river comes.

And it shall come to pass that fishermen shall stand beside it from En-gedi even to En-eglaim; it shall be a place for the spreading of nets. Their fish shall be according to their kinds, as the fish of the Great Sea, exceeding many.
Its swamps and its marshes shall not be healed; they are given over to salt.

And by the river, on its bank on this side and on that side, will grow every tree for food; its leaf will not wither, nor will its fruit fail. Month by month it will bear firstfruits, because its waters flow out from the sanctuary. And its fruit will be for food, and its leaf for healing.
Thus says the Lord GOD: This is the boundary by which you shall divide the land as an inheritance for the twelve tribes of Israel; Joseph shall have two portions.
And you shall inherit it, each man alike with his brother, for I lifted up My hand to give it to your fathers; and this land shall fall to you for an inheritance.
And this shall be the border of the land: on the north side, from the Great Sea by the way of Hethlon, as one goes to Zedad.
Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath, Hazar-hatticon, which is by the border of Hauran.
And the border from the sea shall be Hazar-enon, the border of Damascus, and on the north northward, and the border of Hamath; this is the side of the north.
And the east side, between Hauran and Damascus and between Gilead and the land of Israel, shall be the Jordan; from the border to the eastern sea you shall measure, and this is the east side.
And the south side southward shall be from Tamar to the waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the brook that goes to the great sea; and this is the south side southward.
And the west side, the Great Sea, from the boundary as far as opposite the entrance of Hamath; this is the west side.
And you shall divide this land for yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.

And it shall come to pass, that you shall divide it by lot for an inheritance for yourselves and for the sojourners who sojourn among you, who have begotten children among you; and they shall be to you as the native-born among the children of Israel; with you they shall receive an inheritance among the tribes of Israel.
And it shall be that in the tribe where the sojourner sojourns among them, there you shall give him his inheritance, declares the Lord GOD.

And these are the names of the tribes: from the northern end, along the way of Hethlon to the entrance of Hamath, Hazar-enan, the border of Damascus to the north beside Hamath, and there shall be for it a side toward the east and the west: Dan, one.
And upon the border of Dan, from the east side to the west side, Asher one.
And upon the border of Asher, from the east side to the west side, Naphtali one.
And upon the border of Naphtali, from the east side to the west side, Manasseh one.
And upon the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west side, Ephraim one.
And upon the border of Ephraim, from the east side to the west side, Reuben one.
And beside the border of Reuben, from the east side to the west side, Judah one.

And beside the border of Judah, from the east side to the west side, shall be the offering which you shall set apart, five and twenty thousand in breadth, and in length as one of the portions, from the east side to the west side; and the sanctuary shall be in the midst of it.
The offering that you shall set apart for the LORD shall be twenty-five thousand in length and ten thousand in width.

And for these shall be the holy contribution for the priests: to the north twenty-five thousand in length, and to the west a width of ten thousand, and to the east a width of ten thousand, and to the south a length of twenty-five thousand; and the sanctuary of the LORD shall be in its midst.
For the priests who are sanctified of the sons of Zadok, who kept the charge of My sanctuary, who did not go astray when the children of Israel went astray, as the Levites went astray.
And the holy contribution from the offering of the land shall be theirs, a most holy place, along the border of the Levites.

And the Levites, alongside the border of the priests, shall have five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth; all the length shall be five and twenty thousand, and the breadth ten thousand.
And they shall not sell any of it, nor exchange it, nor shall the firstfruits of the land pass over to another, for it is holy to the LORD.

And the five thousand that remain in the breadth, over against the five and twenty thousand, shall be common land for the city, for dwelling and for open space; and the city shall be in the midst of it.

And these are its measurements: the north side five hundred and four thousand, and the south side five hundred and four thousand, and on the east side five hundred and four thousand, and the west side five hundred and four thousand.
And the open land for the city shall be to the north two hundred and fifty, and to the south two hundred and fifty, and to the east two hundred and fifty, and to the west two hundred and fifty.

And the remainder in the length, alongside the holy contribution, ten thousand eastward and ten thousand westward, and it shall be alongside the holy contribution; and its produce shall be for food for the workers of the city.
And they that serve the city shall serve it out of all the tribes of Israel.
All the contribution shall be twenty-five thousand by twenty-five thousand; you shall set apart the holy contribution as a fourth, together with the possession of the city.

And the remainder shall be for the prince, on this side and on that side of the holy contribution and of the possession of the city, over against the twenty-five thousand of the contribution, as far as the eastern border, and westward over against the twenty-five thousand, as far as the western border, answering to the portions for the prince; and the holy contribution and the sanctuary of the house shall be in its midst.

And from the possession of the Levites, and from the possession of the city, which are in the midst, shall be for the prince; between the border of Judah and between the border of Benjamin shall it be for the prince.
And as for the rest of the tribes, from the east side to the west side, Benjamin one.
And upon the border of Benjamin, from the east side to the west side, Simeon one.
And upon the border of Simeon, from the east side to the west side, Issachar one.
And beside the border of Issachar, from the east side to the west side, Zebulun one.
And by the border of Zebulun, from the east side to the west side, Gad one.
And by the border of Gad, at the south side toward the south, the border shall be from Tamar to the waters of Meribath-kadesh, to the brook, to the great sea.
This is the land which you shall allot as an inheritance to the tribes of Israel, and these are their portions, declares the Lord GOD.
And these are the goings out of the city: on the north side, five hundred and four thousand by measure.
And the gates of the city shall be after the names of the tribes of Israel: three gates northward, one gate of Reuben, one gate of Judah, one gate of Levi.
And on the east side five hundred and four thousand; and the gates three: the gate of Joseph one, the gate of Benjamin one, the gate of Dan one.
And on the south side five hundred and four thousand in measure; and the gates three: the gate of Simeon one, the gate of Issachar one, the gate of Zebulun one.
On the west side four thousand and five hundred, with their gates three: the gate of Gad one, the gate of Asher one, the gate of Naphtali one.
All around shall be eighteen thousand; and the name of the city from that day shall be, The LORD Is There.
